sentence.Network_en: Their new manifesto hardly threatens to bring the whole edifice of capitalism crashing down.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们新的宣言声称要摧毁整个资本主义大厦，这是不可能的。

sentence.Network_en: The American consulate was a magnificent edifice in the centre of Bordeaux.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国领事馆是位于波尔多市中心的一座宏伟的大厦。

sentence.Network_en: He surveyed the edifice from the outside and admired greatly.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从外边打量着大厦,对它赞美备至.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin aedificium, from aedis 'dwelling' + facere 'make'

encyclopedia.content: EDIFICE原指的意思就是大厦，雄伟的建筑物。EDIFICE也指卡西欧重金属系列。 EDIFICE系列，包括了CHRONOGRAPH秒表系列、Analogue（Muti-Hand）指针系列、Digital数字系列、OTHERS其它，成熟中渗透着休闲气息，优雅中流露出潇洒情调，Casio推出的Edifice情侣指针系列手表，百变的表款，搭配不同的心情。 EF系列的手表属于卡西欧中端手表，定位低于卡西欧海神系列，表盘及表带一般都是由不锈钢制成。设计灵感来自汽车仪表盘，表盘风

entry.def: An edifice is a large and impressive building.

example.ex: The American consulate was a magnificent edifice in the centre of Bordeaux.
example.tran: 美国领事馆是位于波尔多市中心的一座宏伟的大厦。

entry.tran: （信仰或传统制度的）体系，结构
entry.def: You can describe a system of beliefs or a traditional institution as an edifice .

means.word_mean: 1. a structure that has a roof and walls and stands more or less permanently in one place;

sentences.sentence: "there was a three-story building on the corner"

auth_sentence.content: The outside of the edifice was encrusted with marble.
auth_sentence.res_content: The outside of the edifice was encrusted with marble.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The outside of the edifice was encrusted with marble.

auth_sentence.content: Opinion Brick by brick, edifice by edifice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Opinion Brick by brick, edifice by edifice.

auth_sentence.content: One logical slip and an entire scientific edifice comes tumbling down.
auth_sentence.res_content: One logical slip and an entire scientific edifice comes tumbling down.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One logical slip and an entire scientific edifice comes tumbling down.
